newsletter.title: Event Recap: Introduce a Girl at Engineering Day @UT-Austin
newsletter.description: This past weekend, SHPE-Austin officers and friends hosted an activity at Girl Day. Students made Hover Crafts using balloons, CD's, paper plates, and tape. Overall, this was a fun event that the team looks forward to again next year.

newsletter.title:
Breakthrough Austin with
NSBE & SHPE
newsletter.description: NSBE Professional and SHPE Austin have been invited to join Breakthrough Austin (BA) this Saturday. BA Students will be preparing skits as part of their semester-long project. Volunteers will mentor the students throughout the process. Date: Mar. 5th (9am-12:30pm) @ St. Andrew's Episcopal School (5901 Southwest Pkwy 78735).For more details  click on the image

newsletter.title: Softball Schedule Finalized
newsletter.description:
SHPE Softball is right around the corner. Games will begin March 7th and the cost to participate is $20. There will be practice games on the weekends. For more information contact Carlos Pizarro. 

Don't delay sign up for softball today

newsletter.title: We're SHPE'ing out Scholarships
newsletter.description: SHPE Austin has opened up the application for the 2016 scholarships. If you have any questions feel free to ask Scholarship Director, Karen Siles.Click on the image to access the scholarship application

newsletter.title: Lunch N Learn by
newsletter.description: SHPE Jr. at LBJ High School is in need of mentors for Lunch and Learns (virtual or in-person) and SHPE Jr. Robotics Meetings. This is a great opportunity if you would like to mentor students interested in robotics or STEM in general. This survey does not commit you to an event, it just shows your interest.

newsletter.title: Membership Spotlight
newsletter.description:
Juan Cortez, Electrical & Comp. Engineer at IBM-Austin, has recently been acknowledged for his contributions to Programming the BeagleBone. More specifically, Juan reviewed tutorials on interfacing with the BeagleBone microcontroller so as to make it easier for a younger audience to understand.
Through this experience, he was also recognized as a winner for the DiscoverE New Faces of Engineering. 
 Congratulations Juan and keep up the great work!

newsletter.title: News You Can Use
newsletter.description:
It has been recently announced that the Texas Board of Professional Engineers (TBPE) will no longer require the professional experience prerequisite for the PE exam. The changes will be propagated to the Oct 2016 exam.

Click on the image to learn more about the PE License
